<@U0177S413PC>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Change Fresh Recipe Order`
*Topic:* `Ad-hoc request (copy update, enabling/disabling feature, etc.)`
*Details:* `Based on the latest recipe scores of new recipes, we want to change the order of fresh recipes in the funnel to the following: chicken, beef, pork, turkey, chicken grain. Please confirm when we can have this change slotted in for`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question
attachments.text:
<@U0177S413PC>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Change Fresh Recipe Order`
*Topic:* `Ad-hoc request (copy update, enabling/disabling feature, etc.)`
*Details:* `Based on the latest recipe scores of new recipes, we want to change the order of fresh recipes in the funnel to the following: chicken, beef, pork, turkey, chicken grain. Please confirm when we can have this change slotted in for`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question

_thread_replies.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
To change the order of fresh recipes in the funnel:

1. Update the preference strings in the menus to reflect the new order:
   - fresh-chicken
   - fresh-beef
   - fresh-pork
   - fresh-turkey
   - fresh-chicken-grain

2. Generate new recipe slots based on the updated preference strings.

3. Add the recipes to the newly generated slots in the desired order.

4. Ensure all multi-protein recipe combinations are also updated accordingly.

Note: This change may require coordination with the team responsible for menu management. Reach out to the appropriate team (possibly #squad-nv-pet-food) to implement these changes.

For more details, please visit <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FVDBJZCK/p1734289546294759?thread_ts=1734289546.294759&utm_source=slack-commander|here>
 *Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C7F8THBGC/p1723651044153509?thread_ts=1723651044.153509&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Need updating of pages >
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FVDBJZCK/p1751907762006549?thread_ts=1751907762.006549&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Issue with changing plans on dashboard> :warning:_This answer was generated based on the available documentation mentioned above, proceed with caution._

Does this resolve your query, <@U0177S413PC>? Yes, resolve it button No, open Unified Search button No, I need help button

<@U022DLAHBUY>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Tech Initiatives and mCVR trends (28d PoP) `
*Topic:* `Checkout`
*Description:* `Multiple marketing vendors (namely First Media & SpoTower) have pulled back in light of declining CVRs. I therefore prepared funnel views in GA to assess where exactly prospects drop off. This report looks at the last 28d PoP (7/16-8/12 vs. 6/18-7/15):
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1UsDTu3cCgjz_8CopGSjfh4iZTdYvVXOPAW3Eim7PozU/edit?usp=sharing>

Were any tests or tech initiatives implemented on either the Address or Payments page in the last 4 weeks?`
*Expected behaviour:* `N/A`
*Actual behaviour:* `CVR of key partners down -5% to -15% over the last 28d per Google Analytics`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-issue

Hi Cade, we had some smaller changes introduced in checkout the last 2 weeks:
 30/Jul/2025 - Trial box food quantity copy in checkout 
 06/Aug/2025 - Money back guarantee banner + no commitment message in checkout
However, I believe this drop could be caused by the air dried cadence test, where we observed the same drops

elements.text: Hi Cade, we had some smaller changes introduced in checkout the last 2 weeks:
30/Jul/2025 - Trial box food quantity copy in checkout
06/Aug/2025 - Money back guarantee banner + no commitment message in checkout
However, I believe this drop could be caused by the air dried cadence test, where we observed the same drops

_thread_replies.text: <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1f5EsVm6o7QHZRe_2zdZzTd6Ikve2TOOQOXohYSHd0Pg/edit?gid=0#gid=0|Air dried cadence test>

files.name: Air dried cadence test pre post
files.title: Air dried cadence test pre post

_thread_replies.text:
Thanks for the context Maria. If I'm reading this correctly, it does seem there's a drop in mCVR from Plans --> Conversion for both users who have and haven't selected air-dried. Any thoughts on why that may be

CC: <@U3XBWJ3ND> to discuss Monday

elements.text:
Thanks for the context Maria. If I'm reading this correctly, it does seem there's a drop in mCVR from Plans --> Conversion for both users who have and haven't selected air-dried. Any thoughts on why that may be

CC:

_thread_replies.text:
You need to compare the drop between the pre period and post period. Look at <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1f5EsVm6o7QHZRe_2zdZzTd6Ikve2TOOQOXohYSHd0Pg/edit?gid=0#gid=0&range=G24|this number> there was a drop of 4.7% across all blended plans.

Users in the test means users with 300+ kcal, users outside of the test means 100-250 kcal.
Users with less calories are converting better (because of the lower prices).

files.title: Air dried cadence test pre post

<@U022DLAHBUY>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `/plans-quiz occasional loading failure`
*Topic:* `Pet Quiz`
*Description:* `I frequently QA marketing URLs to ensure that vouchers & other parameters are properly apprehended. Over the course of the last few weeks, there have been multiple cases where the /plans-quiz page does not load. It is inconsistent, though Lindsay also witnessed this on desktop. I have not been able to replicate on mobile.

Please see the screen recording under "Actual behaviour."`
*Expected behaviour:* `Quiz loads`
*Actual behaviour:* `Quiz does not load:
<https://www.loom.com/share/8acaed5b226a49aea2795fdcab203562?sid=cbc93a6e-8c7a-4a77-834a-f7277c6455c9>

_thread_replies.text: Upon QA'ing the same link, the page does now load on my end, though again, failure is inconsistent

elements.text: Upon QA'ing the same link, the page does now load on my end, though again, failure is inconsistent

_thread_replies.text: The loading spinner is an indication of data being fetched to prepare the quiz. If it gets stuck it means either our BE services for some reason are not responding with required data, or there are network issues on clients end. I will check our monitoring and see if there is any spike in failed requests for the quiz data fetches

elements.text: The loading spinner is an indication of data being fetched to prepare the quiz. If it gets stuck it means either our BE services for some reason are not responding with required data, or there are network issues on clients end. I will check our monitoring and see if there is any spike in failed requests for the quiz data fetches

_thread_replies.text: Thank you!

This may also explain why it is not reproducible on mobile
